SEARCH

All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
Board
The Board class represents the game board containing pieces.
BoardView
The BoardView class represents the graphical user interface for the Arimaa game board.
Check
This class provides various checks and validations for the game, including move validation, push and pull checks, and win condition checks.
CheckTest
 
Clock
This class handles the game clock and timer functionality.
ClockTest
 
ComputerPlayer
This class represents a computer player in the game.
ComputerPlayerTest
 
FinishArrangement
The FinishArrangement class represents a dialog window to finish the initial arrangement phase of the game.
GameController
GameController class manages the flow of the game, including player actions, game state transitions, and interaction with views.
GameControllerTest
 
GameState
The GameState class represents the state of the game at a certain point in time.
LoadGame
The LoadGame class provides functionality to load a game from a file, read the game history, and restore the game state.
Main
The Main class contains the main method to start the Arimaa game application.
MenuView
The MenuView class represents the main menu of the game.
Move
The Move class represents a move made by a player in the game.
MoveHistory
The MoveHistory class manages the history of all moves made during the game.
MyTimer
The MyTimer class represents the game timer window.
NewGameView
The NewGameView class represents the window for starting a new game.
Piece
The Piece class represents a game piece in Arimaa.
Piece.Colors
The Colors enum represents colors of pieces.
Piece.Pieces
The Pieces enum represents the types of pieces and thier strength and notation.
Player
The Player class represents a player in the Arimaa game.
Player.Color
The Color enum represents the colors of players.
SaveGame
The SaveGame class provides functionality to save the current state of the game.
ShowTurns
The ShowTurns class represents the window for displaying game turn options and history.
